intro: Alsine moehringioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and edible parts. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, smooth seeds. Alsine moehringioides is often found in disturbed areas and can serve as an indicator of dry, open habitats.
